pageTitle: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas of the Repub : Under-Recovery on Diesel Effective 16.02.2013 increases to Rs 10.27 per litre mark
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {60952=The Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC) under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas have reviewed international prices of crude oil and petroleum products during the Ist Fortnight ofFebruary 2013. Accordingly, the under-recovery on High Speed Diesel (HSD) applicable for 2ndfortnight of February effective 16.02.2013 has increased to Rs10.27 /Litre. This was Rs 9.22 per litre effective 11.2.2013 for Ist fortnight of February2013. In case of Domestic LPG and PDS Kerosene under-recoveries remain same at Rs 481.00/ cylinder Rs 31.60 per litre respectively for February 2013 as under-recoveries on these products are computed on monthly basis., 60680=February Under-recovery on Domestic LPG, and PDS Kerosene remain high OMCs Incurring Daily Under-Recoveries of Rs 454 Crore Crude Oil Price for Indian Basket went up to US$ 114.49 per barrel on February 15, 2013, 65807=OMCs effective 16 February 2013 are incurring daily under-recovery of aboutRs454 crore on the sale of Diesel, PDS Kerosene and Domestic LPG. This was Rs 400 crore per day for the previous fortnight effective 1.2.2013., 66246=Further, the OMC's have reported the following under-recoveries during April-December 2012:, 75743=RCJ/RKS - Under-recovery 18-02-2013}
